questions.question_text:
You are deploying Microsoft Teams Phone.
You need to provide a user with a device on his desk that can be used when the user's computer is turned off. The device must meet the following requirements:
✑ Support calls.
✑ Support video.
Support speed dial.
//IMG//

✑ Display chat history.
Which type of device should you provide?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Teams Display it is. A full fledged Teams device
key word is : chat history so i will go with Display

Selected Answer: A
Teams-certified handset - ITS compact to user desk, and STANDALONE, support v,vc,chat history...
I suppose it could be also MTR technically, but practically it doesn´t really fit well on a desk.

questions.question_text:
You are deploying Microsoft Skype for Business 3PIP phones to remote sites for use with Microsoft Teams.
You need to sign each 3PIP phone in to Teams.
What are two possible ways to achieve the goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: I think C & E are correct. Remote provisioning is only available on native Teams Phones afaik.

I agree, found this:
3PIP Phone Interop with Microsoft Teams -
 Authentication: All Skype for Business sign-in capabilities are only supported with username auth and web sign in. Pin Auth is not supported.

choices.C: From the device, instruct a local user to sign in by using the device itself.
choices.D: From the device, instruct a local user to use the direct inward dial (DID) number and PIN of the assigned account.
choices.E: From the device, instruct a local user to sign in from the web.
choices.A: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, remotely provision a new device.
choices.B: From the device, instruct a local user to sign in from a computer that connects to the device by using a USB cable.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You have a Microsoft Teams Rooms on Windows system in a local conference room. The system is NOT joined to Active Directory.
You need to ensure that the system can be managed by using RDP.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
the answer is wrong. No CTRL-ALT-DEL is nessesary because the computer is not domain joined. The correct answer should be:
Go to windows settings, select administrator account, change rdp setting&sign off.
The andser is correct, but wrong order.

1. Press CTRL-ALT-DEL (to access the logon screen)
2. Select the Administrator account and enter the password.
3. Configure the Remote Desktop settings and sign out

questions.question_text:
You need to change the meeting entry notifications to play a tone instead of each attendee's recorded name.
What should you configure in the Microsoft Teams admin center?

discussion.content:
1. Log in to the admin center.
2. In the left navigation, go to Meetings > Conference Bridges.
3. At the top of the Conference Bridges page, click Bridge Settings.
4. In the Bridge settings pane, enable or disable Meeting entry and exit notifications. This is selected by default. 5. If you clear it, users who have already joined the meeting won't be notified when someone enters or leaves the meeting.
6. Under Entry/exit announcement type, select Names or phone numbers or Tones.

choices.A: the Caller ID policies node under Voice
choices.C: the Conference bridges node under Meetings
choices.B: the Meeting settings node under Meetings
choices.D: the Resource accounts node under Voice
choices.E: the Meeting policies node under Meetings

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that has Modern authentication enabled for all services. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enforced for all users.
You are deploying Microsoft Teams Rooms.
The first time you attempt to sign in to a Teams Rooms, you receive an error message indicating that the device cannot sign in to Teams.
You verify that Modern authentication is enabled in Teams Rooms.
What prevents you from signing in?
questions.answer_description:
Because Microsoft Teams Rooms uses resource owner password credentials authorization and the underlying REST APIs for modern authentication, the following are important differences to be aware of that are specific to Microsoft Teams Rooms.
* MFA isn't supported regardless of the topology you have.
* Etc.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/rooms/rooms-authentication

choices.C: The Teams Rooms account is not licensed for Microsoft Intune.
choices.A: Teams Rooms must be domain-joined first.
choices.B: MFA is unsupported in Teams Rooms.
choices.D: The Microsoft Authenticator app is not configured for the Teams Rooms account.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct
